page.title: 06FOX FRUIT FARM continued
page.content: Early in 1984 Fox Fruit built a freezer amd processing room.They had enlarged their business to include the processing of soft fruits.They do not grow these themselves but buy from local farmers as well as from abroad. Fruit comes from Yugoslavia,Poland and from as far away as New Zealand.When the fruit arrives it is frozen, then inspected for leaf and other impurities, graded for size and colour and packed,in the processing room, into 18 kilo boxes. It is then retuned to the freezer where it is stored until sold. It is sold to food manufacturers throughout the country. Ten women are employed in the processing room,working from 8:30 to 4:30pm.Because the room is chilled they were provided with "Moon-boots" last winter.It was very cold work then but very nice on hot summer days.
